get active file/TFile.description: Obsidian: Get the TFile of the currently active note.

get Tfile of active leaf.description: Obsidian: Get the TFile of a leaf, checking if the active leaf is a markdown file.
body: const tfile = currentLeaf.view instanceof MarkdownView ? currentLeaf.view.file : null;

recent files.description: Obsidian: Get the 10 most recent files, as an array of file-path strings. (The 10 most recent files are the ones visible in the Quick Switcher, when there no input yet.)

get editor.description: Obsidian: Get the editor of the currently active note.
body: // getActiveViewOfType will return null if the active view is
// null or not of type MarkdownView.

get TFile from path.description: Obsidian: Get the TFile corresponding to the (vault-relative) file path string.

add command.description: Obsidian: Add a command to the command palette, making it also available as a hotkey. Usually added to the `onload()` call of the plugin.

add editor command.description: Obsidian: Add a command to the command palette that is only active in edit mode and passes the currently active editor to the respective method.

Run Command.description: Run a command from another plugin or from Obsidian core.

set config.description: Set a configuration value for the core Obsidian settings.

get config.description: Get a configuration value from the core Obsidian settings.

Multiple Cursors?.description: Obsidian: Check whether there are currently multiple cursors.

Write a file.description: Obsidian: Write text to an existing file.

get selection (edit mode).description: Obsidian: Get the selection in Live Preview / Source mode.

get selection (reading mode).description: Obsidian: Get the selection in Reading Mode. (Note that this will retrieve plain text without formatting.)
